relation: Returns a byte array that represents the Oracle NUMBER in Oracle internal format
Indicates whether the current instance is an integer
Indicates whether the current instance has a null value
Indicates whether the current instance is greater than 0
Indicates whether the current instance has a zero value
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {589009=The supplied total number of days for a time interval. Range of days is -1000,000,000 < totalDays < 1000,000,000., 1026839=This static field represents the maximum valid date and time for an OracleTimeStamp structure, which is December 31, 9999 23:59:59.999999999., 1028248=This static field represents the minimum valid date and time for an OracleTimeStamp structure, which is January 1, -4712 0:0:0., 1057898=The OracleTimeStamp with a value of "December 31, 9999 23:59:59.99" results in the string "December 31, 9999 23:59:59.99000" when SetPrecision() is called with the fractional second precision set to 5., 138449=This static field represents the maximum valid date for an OracleDate structure, which is December 31, 9999 23:59:59., 587253="1 2:3:4.99" means 1 day, 2 hours, 3 minutes, 4 seconds, and 990 milliseconds or 1 day, 2 hours, 3 minutes, 4 seconds, and 990000000 nanoseconds., 632674=The OracleIntervalDS with a value of "1 2:3:4.99" results in the string "001 2:3:4.99000" when SetPrecision() is called, with the day precision set to 3 and fractional second precision set to 5., 671715="1 2:3:4.99" means 1 day, 2 hours, 3 minutes 4 seconds and 990 milliseconds or 1 day, 2 hours, 3 minutes 4 seconds and 990000000 nanoseconds., 629359="1 2:3:4.99" means 1 day, 2 hours, 3 minutes, 4 seconds, and 990 milliseconds or 1 day, 2 hours, 3 minutes, 4 seconds, and 990000000 nanoseconds., 139819=This static field represents the minimum valid date for an OracleDate structure, which is January 1, -4712.}
textBeforeTable: Table 5-36 OracleDecimal Properties The OracleDecimal properties are listed in Table 5-36. OracleDecimal Properties Returns the float representation of the OracleDecimal value explicit operator float Returns the long representation of the OracleDecimal value explicit operator long Returns the int representation of the OracleDecimal value explicit operator int Returns the short representation of the OracleDecimal value explicit operator short Returns the double representation of the OracleDecimal value explicit operator double Returns the decimal representation of the OracleDecimal value explicit operator decimal Returns the byte representation of the OracleDecimal value explicit operator byte Description Operator
textAfterTable: OracleDecimal Instance Methods The OracleDecimal instance methods are listed in Table 5-37. Table 5-37 OracleDecimal Instance Methods Method Description CompareTo Compares the current instance to the supplied object and returns an integer that represents their relative values Equals Determines whether an object is an instance of OracleDecimal, and whether the value of the object is equal to the current instance (Overloaded) GetHashCode Returns a hash code for the current instance GetType Inherited from Object ToByte Returns the byte representation of the current instance ToDouble Returns the double representation of the current instance ToInt16 Returns the Int16 representation of the current instance
